answers.answer: I read your profile.  You Need To Call Your Doctor NOW!  In the Navy we treated athletes foot with plain bleach and water but you need to get specialized attention ASAP-Whatever your Diabetes Dr. gives you just ask him or her to clear it with your Hepatologist 1st so you won't harm your liver -ask your pharmacist to call your Doctor(s).  I can't tell you how many times my pharmacist caught errors-medications that didn't jive or mix with other meds I was on-A good pharmacist is worth their weight in gold and we or I am just beginning to understand that they are an important part of Tx. # months into treatment my Hepatologist wrote a wrong script and my Pharmacist caught it.  I would have taken less-the vials looked the same but the dosage was way less.

question: I need to take an oral antifungal to treat a resistent fungal infection on my foot and ankle but fear liver damage as most seem to be liver toxic. Has anyone had any experience with this. I am also a type 2 diabetic so all infections are slow healing.
title: Any safe oral antifungals?
